title: 'Main Menu' Client lag on League of Legends?
body:
Originally i thought it was just some temporary issue but i've noticed that after i log in, the 'main menu' client itself will have lagging issues, to where the timer for match founds get stuck and could end up expiring before i can even hit accept, because the 'main menu' client suddenly skip lags, sometimes it happens when i open other things like the item set, rune page, etc. But it especially shows a small lag spike sometimes while in character select menu and the match start timer just ends.

Its quite irritating and i believe im not the only one who has the issue. Based on what i've heard from other players it something to do with the servers, but considering how bad it seems. I really would of thought the Riot team might of taken the time to actually 'remedy' the issue ASAP.

replies.body:
It sounds like your client is having a hard time establishing a stable connection to the server. There are a number of network settings or configurations that could cause this issue, so I recommend working through the steps outlined in our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to start. 

Let me know if you notice any changes after working through those steps.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=U2dG69F6,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-08-15T20:52:50.670+0000)
>
> It sounds like your client is having a hard time establishing a stable connection to the server. There are a number of network settings or configurations that could cause this issue, so I recommend working through the steps outlined in our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to start. 
> 
> Let me know if you notice any changes after working through those steps.

Problem is it didn't start till one of the previous patches a few weeks ago (which considering i've been around league of legends for atleast over a year). I have never had the client itself specifically lag or the game itself unless something was causing it to bug out, like some server issue.

I have tried 'repairing the client to fix it' via the start up menu's ? repair option, but it does not seem to have fully resolved it. Plus it does not seem to occur when im actually in a match itself.

Since patches only modify local files inside your League directory, they're *extremely unlikely* to affect your connection. The reason I suspect a problem along your connection is because each step you take, from accepting a queue pop, to selecting your champ and locking in, to selecting a ban, all requires you to synchronize those actions with the server. If your connection drops, or isn't strong enough to sync those actions, it can create the symptoms you're seeing. 

Let me know the results of the steps from the connection guide.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=U2dG69F6,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-08-16T15:46:45.549+0000)

The reason I suspect a problem along your connection is because each step you take, from accepting a queue pop, to selecting your champ and locking in, to selecting a ban, all requires you to synchronize those actions with the server. If your connection drops, or isn't strong enough to sync those actions, it can create the symptoms you're seeing. 
> 
> Let me know the results of the steps from the connection guide.

If i had to use other games as reference to the connectivity like Hearthstone, how it originally was with LoL 'a few patches ago, BEFORE it started occurring' or even make use of Final Fantasy 14 thru a PS4 after i unplug the same ethernet cable connection i use for my PC to play LoL, i can say for certain i never had any 'laggy' issues between all of them.

Since the 'repair' option didn't fix the issue and i don't recall any DDoS attacks going on recently on League of legends (which would affect the matches too so that would make LITTLE sense), its sounding more like the 'server itself' is having synchronization issues when it originally did not. Which makes sense since i've seen a few people talking about having the same issue amongst the forums and in the game too. So i would suggest you might want to take it up with whichever group you have that handles server upkeep/maintenance to check for any similar errors to 'corrupt files' that might be the result of why multiple players could be having this synchronization issue.

If that's not the case then i really wonder what's causing it, since i would think 'repairing a client's files' would be the same as fresh installing the game. Plus do not think it might be some issue with a firewall because i never had that issue before and i would not be stupid enough as some net'cafes do with tacking third party program add'ons onto games for people. I may consider some in MMORPG games that make information easier to read or tidy up a HUD, but for MOBAs its something that should never of been tacked on, even in regular mode games.

At this point i hope that Alpha client gets pushed a little quicker because i really don't want League of Legends to go the way of Wakfu, which still even for 5 years, that french MMORPG has ran in Java, but it had memory leak issues that became extremely visible once the game was 'officially' released and it required tweaking the Java settings to just mitigate it partially, yet it still had the issues even then.

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}} 


""ADDED NOTE ON 8/16/2016"

Ok now i'm really getting annoyed, im trying to arrange my item sets and masteries to clean them up and add some more for some recent champion additions to my roster i got. But the client synchronization is so horrible, i literally can crash out of league of legends while waiting it to load, 'literally' multiple times. Sometimes end up with repeated 2 to 8 second delays while moving some things around. This is getting silly.

{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

Can you confirm you've tried all the steps in the connection guide that I linked previously? Repairing game files will not affect your local network configuration, and at this point, going through that guide is a necessary step in working towards a permanent solution for this issue.
